text: Unfortunately same errors

Yeah pieter, I’m sorry for this. for a long time the sdk had different versions available if you were using serverless functions in HubSpot, coding with custom code actions or using the newest available package. When I couldn’t keep my code consistent across apps and versions I just got into doing everything with axios.

Hi <@U06BD7XBFPB>. As promised, here is an example to query the HubSpot API and then write the results to a Google Sheet. I also included an example of the cron job syntax fo linux or Mac. Hope this helps.

<@U089FH6ALV8> sorry to hear that. Check out this doc which refers to "the <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/import-and-export/set-up-your-import-file?hubs_content=knowledge.HubSpot.com/import-and-export/troubleshoot-import-errors&hubs_content-cta=format#date-format|format> you selected during the<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/import-and-export/import-objects?hubs_content=knowledge.HubSpot.com/import-and-export/troubleshoot-import-errors&hubs_content-cta=%20import%20process.#:~:text=if%20you're%20importing%20a%20file%20with%20a%20date%20property%2C%20use%20the%20date%20format%20dropdown%20menu%20to%20confirm%20how%20the%20date%20values%20in%20your%20spreadsheet%20are%20formatted.| import process>"

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/import-and-export/troubleshoot-import-errors#could-not-parse-date>
When creating a User via API, is there anyway to specify the state that the user should be created with (active - inactive / enabled - disabled)?

hey , can I create an association between the "tasks" and the "custom object" I created in HubSpot through Make?
if yes, where can i find this number?
You are the best <@U089FSD6JM6>!! Thank you SO so much! This is so helpful!!!

Hey Tai. Try not to post in multiple channels.

You can find all your custom objects and their IDs within this link:
<https://app.HubSpot.com/l/sales-products-settings/object>

Hi Folks!
I'm using HubSpot to send SMS messages to my website's users. We collect express consent in-app, but I don't see a way to automatically update that consent in HubSpot - only the manual way as described in <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/sms/collect-and-manage-consent-to-send-sms-messages>.


Is there a way to update sms consent via HubSpot's API?

Hello, is there a way to programmatically get the reports (open rate, CTR, etc) from sequences?
There is no API exposed.
Use case: automated alerts in Slack for Sequence performance
nope
The way to get around that is to mention that you will ask for consent in the first text message, then send it through HubSpot

Mention on site you mean, right?
When I tried to send a text message without having collected consent already, the text didn't go through. I thought this was expected behavior?
I’m not sure that is in a property
get `<https://api.HubSpot.com/crm/v3/properties/user>` and you can see all properties
sorry, I am thinking of a different system
for HubSpot they have to text your registered sms number and say START or SUBSCRIBE

Alright, thanks for your help!
We'll keep looking for a way around this. It's very clunky to have our users leave the site, type in a phone number and text us. Much better if we can send the first text and let them reply.

Thanks again. Please let me know if you happen across any way to do this within HubSpot
when you say you collect express consent in app, what do you mean in app
we have a website where people click a button that says 'please send me sms messages' and they type in their phone number
```<a href="sms:+1234567890?body=Please%20SUBSCRIBE%20Me">Send Text Message</a>```
Good idea! Not a perfect solution, but miles better than what we had before. Thanks again Nicholas!

Hi! Im not sure if this is the right place to ask, but i have built an automation flow that creates and patches blog posts from an external source. But for some reason when i PATCH the blgo post in my flow, the blog post will not be retrieved from blog_recent_posts for example even though its published, there are no errors and the HubSpot UI Tells me its public. Anyone ran into this before? Did i miss a hidden field in my patch body?

i have the patch api call body below:

`{`
      "categoryId": 3,
      "contentGroupId": "56533086731",
      "contentTypeCategory": 3,
      "publishImmediately": true,
      "currentState": "PUBLISHED",
      "state": "PUBLISHED",
      "currentlyPublished": true,
      "authorName": "example",
      "blogAuthorId": "12345",
      "useFeaturedImage": false,
      "metaDescription": " -- example",
      "name": "example",
      "widgets": {
        "module_1633098721709224": {
         "body": {
                  "bio": "",
                 "img_url": "",
                 "job": "GZ-psycholoog, Supervisor Register Schematherapie, Supervisor VGCt",
                 "module_id": 56534809345,
                 "teacher_id": "example",
                 "widget_name": "FO - HG - Teacher content",
                 "teacher_email": "<mailto:jet.alberts@protonmail.com|e>xample",
                 "teacher_name": "example",
        "index": 1
      },
          "child_css": {},
          "css": {},
          "id": "module_1633098721709224",
          "label": "FO - HG - Teacher content",
          "module_id": 56534809345,
          "name": "module_162341733827115",
          "order": 4,
          "styles": {},
          "type": "module"
        }
      }
    }

could this be a caching issue? Can you share the link and I’ll let you know if I see it?

also use ` three times to get a block of code
no problem - best thing I got, better than nothing, sorry it wasn’t great lol
hey- I'm not complaining

At some point recently, the CRM properties API started returning the `type` of all of our boolean properties as "enumeration" instead of "bool"; their `fieldType` is still returning as "booleancheckbox". Is this an expected change? I didn't see anything in <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog>...

```{
  "hidden": false,
  "displayOrder": 2,
  "description": "whatever",
  "label": "test checkbox is the thing",
  "type": "bool",
  "groupName": "BHG",
  "name": "testcheckbox",
  "fieldType": "booleancheckbox",
  "options": [
    {
      "label": "True",
      "value": "true",
      "hidden": false,
      "displayOrder": 1
    },
    {
      "label": "False",
      "value": "false",
      "hidden": false,
      "displayOrder": 2
    }
  ]
}```
I just created that property via the api
Yes, I also made a new one and it's working for that one

looking it up

```{
    "updatedAt": "2025-01-22T00:54:47.897Z",
    "createdAt": "2025-01-22T00:54:47.897Z",
    "name": "testcheckbox",
    "label": "test checkbox is the thing",
    "type": "bool",
    "fieldType": "booleancheckbox",
    "description": "whatever",
    "groupName": "bhg",
    "options": [
        {
            "label": "True",
            "value": "true",
            "displayOrder": 1,
            "hidden": false

}```
I'm not as annoyed by the `type` changing as I am by the fact that I can't change it back because it says I have too many options
So — What I have noticed recently, and I can probably give a month aroudn when this happened because it was a specific project I worked on
but when I create them via the UI it does weird things I think
and makes it an enum with two options
maye i’m wrong, going to check that

sometime during september is when I noticed it.
<https://share.zight.com/kpuznBPn>

Thank you for asking this — I have had this in my mind that something was different I just stored it away to never be talked about again
